page.title: 20Transport and Education
page.content: Access to Brownsea is by boat from Poole or from Sandbanks in Bournemouth and passenger motor-boats run half-hourly between 10.00 and 18.00 hours. The return fare is Â£1.90 for adults or Â£1.20 for children, and passengers must also pay a landing-fee to the National Trust on disembarking at the Town Quay on the island. Private vessels may land without charge at the opposite end of the island. Four children, all from families of National Trust Staff travel to their schools in Poole and Parkstone by boat as there is no school on Brownsea itself. There are two girls and two boys who attend school in Poole. They expressed mixed views on life for young people on Brownsea_ the boys liked "mucking about in boats" but the girls felt there was "not much to do".
